borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="">The proposed change of use from the rear of commercial unit (Use Class E) to a place of worship and communities help centre (Use Class&nbsp;F1(f)) would result in the loss of floorspace for a retail unit which sits within a neighbourhood centre, and the development fails to demonstrate a need for this facility in this location, the development is deemed to be unacceptable and contrary to:</p><ul><li style="">Paragraph&nbsp;86 of the&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;(<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="NPPF" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmnzirmclc6bd9jq">NPPF</span>) (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DLUHC" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmnzirly972s8hof">DLUHC</span>, September 2023) </li><li style="">Policies&nbsp;SD6, SD7, SD8 and&nbsp;E9&nbsp;of the London Plan (March 2021)</li><li style="">Policies CM1, CM5 and CE1&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</li><li style="">Policies BE1 and BE2 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)&nbsp;&nbsp;</li><li style="">Policies DME3 and DME5 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>

<p style="">The proposal has failed&nbsp;to provide&nbsp;a noise assessment that would look at the potential noise impacts from the proposed use and how those should be mitigated. Within this information the Council is unable to determine whether the proposal would not have an unacceptable impact on residential and commercial&nbsp;neighbour&nbsp;amenity.&nbsp;As such, the development is contrary to:&nbsp;<br></p><ul><li style="">Paragraph 130(f)&nbsp;of the&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;(<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="NPPF" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmnziupibjxjpyz2">NPPF</span>) (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DLUHC" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmnziupfbt7472jc">DLUHC</span>, September 2023)<br></li><li style="">Policies&nbsp;D6 , D13, and&nbsp;D14 of the&nbsp;London Plan (March 2021)<br></li><li style="">Policy BP8 and BP11&nbsp;of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)&nbsp;&nbsp;<br></li><li style="">Policy DMSI 3 of the&nbsp;London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>

<p style="">The proposal has failed to provide a transport statement and&nbsp;travel plan demonstrating opening and closing times and days of the weeks its open and activities involved, trip generation including maximum number of visitors expected and modes of travel, comparison sites and its running information and site access information. As a result, the proposal could have a harmful impact on the highways and surrounding area and is contrary to:</p><ul><li style="">Paragraphs 104 - 106 of the National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;(<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="NPPF" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmnzietztlvznhda">NPPF</span>) (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DLUHC" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lpmnzietw0phru2rd">DLUHC</span>, September 2023)</li><li style="">Policies T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6 of the London Plan (March 2021)</li><li style="">Policies BR10 and BR11 of the the&nbsp;&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</li><li style="">Policies DMD 1 and DMT1 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>

<p style="">The proposal has failed&nbsp;to provide and show that the site would be capable of providing conveniently located and sufficient refuse and recycling storage facilities. As such, the development is contrary to: </p><ul><li style="">Policy DMSI 8&nbsp;of&nbsp;the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>

<p style="">The proposal has failed&nbsp;to provide an adequate and necessary long-term and short-term cycle parking facilities on or off-site site&nbsp;that comply with the London Cycling Design Standards. The lack of cycle parking would result in a failure to ensure that active travel options have been provided and to improve non-car modes of transportation. As such, the development is contrary to:&nbsp; </p><ul><li style="">Policy T5&nbsp; and Table 10.2 of the London Plan (March 2021)</li><li style="">Policy BR9 of the&nbsp;&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011) </li><li style="">Policy DMT 3 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>
subdivision_of_building: Rear ground floor of the existing building
description: Proposed change of use of the rear of retail unit (Use Class E) to a place of worship and communities help centre (Use Class F1(f)) .

constraints_details.result: 2a Woodward Road, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM9 4SH
